title: How to Knit a Bracelet

steps.headline: Row 2: Purl 5.
steps.description: Alternating knit and purl rows creates the Stockinette. On the right side, this stitch looks like a series of V's. The wrong side is bumpy, and resembles the Garter stitch.

steps.headline: Repeat rows 1 and 2 until the bracelet is the required length.
On a knit row, cast off.
Thread the tail on to a wool needle and seam up the cast on and cast off row together using a duplicate stitch.
Thread a 18 inch (45.7 cm) piece of yarn onto the thread needle.
steps.description: Tie a double knot with the yarn and sew the seams together with a simple whipstitch.

tyn: Wool needle (also known as a tapestry needle)
text: To begin, cast on 5 stitches.  Row 1: Knit 5.  Row 2: Purl 5. Alternating knit and purl rows creates the Stockinette. On the right side, this stitch looks like a series of V's. The wrong side is bumpy, and resembles the Garter stitch. Repeat rows 1 and 2 until the bracelet is the required length.  On a knit row, cast off. Leave a six inch tail. Thread the tail on to a wool needle and seam up the cast on and cast off row together using a duplicate stitch.  Thread a 18 inch (45.7 cm) piece of yarn onto the thread needle. Tie a double knot with the yarn and sew the seams together with a simple whipstitch. Weave in all ends.  Finished.
